definition: in a low position, filled with melancholy and despondency, the lowest forward gear ratio in the gear box of a motor vehicle, make a low noise, characteristic of bovines
details:
adverb
- in a low position
adjective
- filled with melancholy and despondency
= synonyms: grim, gloomy, blue, depressed, dispirited, down, downcast, downhearted, down in the mouth, low-spirited
- of the most contemptible kind
= synonyms: miserable, scummy, abject, low-down, scurvy
- literal meanings
- less than normal in degree or intensity or amount
= example: less than normal in degree or intensity or amount
- used of sounds and voices
= example: used of sounds and voices
= synonyms: high
- very low in volume
= example: very low in volume
= synonyms: low-toned
- subdued or brought low in condition or status
= example: subdued or brought low in condition or status
= synonyms: humiliated, broken, crushed, humbled
- unrefined in character
= example: unrefined in character
- no longer sufficient
= example: no longer sufficient
= synonyms: depleted
- low or inferior in station or quality
= synonyms: small
noun
- the lowest forward gear ratio in the gear box of a motor vehicle
= synonyms: first
- a low level or position or degree
= example: a low level or position or degree
- an air mass of lower pressure
= synonyms: depression
verb
- make a low noise, characteristic of bovines
= synonyms: moo
